Two years after being announced it was coming, NBN is finally starting to be rolled out in my area.

I one of the lucky people who got the fibre to the house and omg.... It's like a lifestyle change; everything happens when you want it to. You don't have to wait for your downloads to finish before you can jump into a game of league and still sit on a stable 20-30 ms ping.

I HATE NBN! We used to be able to download roughly 3 movies at a time, duo league in the same room, listen to music on youtube, be signed into fb on both computers and have youtube playing on the tv simultaneously. NBN was installed outside our house and ever since, we've had to close our browsers, pause all downloads and can't watch youtube on the tv just so we could duo... _while_ hitting major ping spikes. Installation of NBN was the worst thing ever and we were "upgraded" to the fastest speed... pffft if we were on the fastest speed, wonder what the low speed would be like... dial up? 

Any way, using Ethernet cable helped. But that meant the main bedroom was turned into the gaming room and the lounge turned into our bedroom. That dedication {{sticker:slayer-pantheon-thumbs}}
NBN comes in several different speeds. 100Mbps being the highest. Check with your ISP if you got the fastest one.
If they're still installing NBN in your neighbourhood, yea you'll get disruptions. I had that while they were building around my place. But since that stopped, everything has been smooth.

Ours is 12ms solid, without fail. NBN da bomb (especially considering we were on 1M crappy Telstra DSL before that).

Personally I can't comment on difference between Ethernet and Wifi, because I don't trust wifi enough to try playing over it...

I play on ethernet, but my housemate plays on wifi coz hes on a laptop. we're connected to the same modem/ router, but he always has connection issues and it's a damn good router too, not a little $50 thing, like a $500 thing. The wifi is fine for services that use loading and buffering, but anything streaming is a no no.

Just run a custom game for yourself and see what your ping is like then.

The thing about that is, one hour your ping might be fine, but then your ISP might hit a peak hour on its network, basically bottle necking anyone on that service. You can't plan for that unfortunately, and having to load up a custom every time you want to check your ping is just a horrendous waste of time.

You should try using this program called "LoLReplay 2" it has a feature that can tell you your ping before you go into game, as well as other things such as recording your games(doesnt make a noticable difference in game when using it either, unlike a lot of other programs, when you play it it plays the game back in spectator mode) also has other features like showing who you are up against in game and changing the login screen with the click of a button and adding customized champion filters for in champ select, really cool program (also you wont get banned for using it or anything, rito says its all good, can look it up if you want as well, i have) but its a real lifesave when someones downloading something which will cause me to lag out, and there are sure people who will play anyway, but i feel a lot of people would not, if they knew they were gonna lag, as it can be very frustrating playing and losing mainly due to you lagging and not being able to do what you want, would be nice though if rito added in all these features into the actual client though so we wouldnt need to rely on a 3rd party program but oh well, will be a while from now till that happens
